intro: Cassine sphaerophylla, commonly known as the globe-leaved cassine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and is characterized by its distinctive globe-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of yellow or green. Cassine sphaerophylla is adapted to coastal and sandy environments, making it a hardy species in tropical regions.
